wikipedia_page.main: Geoffrey Arthur Marlow (13 December 1914 – 8 November 1978) was an English professional footballer who scored 20 goals from 86 appearances in the Football League playing as a winger for Lincoln City either side of the Second World War. He also played in the Minor Counties Cricket Championship for Lincolnshire.

response: * 8 November 1978 - Geoff Marlow, 63, was a left-winger for Lincoln City between 1937 and 1949, with the war restricting him to just 80 league appearances for the Sincil Bank side, scoring 26 goals.
